text:
I was able to buy my dream car in cash at 20

Had just started a company

And I wanted to network with wealthy owners to sell to consulting firms easier.

They see a kid step out, immediately ask "what do you do?" 

Payed countless dividends

Anyone else have any similar networking tactics?

text:
My trading portfolio to 6 figures (while in college)

I started trading at 16

Lost 90% of my portfolio on stupid options bets.

More important than the number though...

Understanding how to hedge risks/make calculated decisions

That all carried into my current venture @pathlit_ai :)

Anyone else have a similar experience with trading + startups?

text:
Black Friday is basically the startup life in one day:

1. 50% Off Everything: Just like my equity after fundraising :(

2. Doorbusters: Like launching a feature at 3 a.m., hoping someone (anyone) notices

3. Competing for Attention: Others choose between TVs and toasters; we fight for VC head nods and beta testers

4. Impulse Buys: Our decisions to implement that cool idea we didnt validate

text:
Email sucks.

AI email assistants are the new crypto. Everyone is making one.

So we made one too. 

Meet Bulb  an email client that actually fixes email instead of adding another layer of chaos.

Not just another AI wrapper around Gmail. Bulb rethinks how you use email.

If you have 10,000+ unread emails and just need to talk to your inbox to fix it all, you need this.
https://t.co/Xq64JBgKRR

text: Letting emotions dictate decisions, whether in trading or startups, never works.
fullText: Letting emotions dictate decisions, whether in trading or startups, never works.

text: One of the toughest lessons I learned was emotional discipline. Letting emotions dictate decisions, whether in trading or startups, never works. Stick to your strategy even when things go wrongearly rejections or churn arent true indicators of success. Set clear metrics and a realistic timeline. If its working, double down. If not, adjust. For example, if youre launching on Product Hunt with no following, aim for 10 users, not 1,000. Keep expectations in check and focus on steady progress.
